resources.string:
Changes in 0.6.8 : 
	- Completely redesigned search (POI, Address)! Make address search much faster and responsiveness. Leave one search with many different search aspects. 
	- Implement search POI by name big areas (countries) 
	- Fix flickering map screen for tablets(Issue 641) 
	- Autofollow route option (Issue 356) 
	- GPX navigation moved to 'Directions' and 'Save Directions' moved to 'About route' 
	- POI data is inside .obf file (download index after 01/10/11) 
	- Voice prompt fixes (about GPS location and about first omitting command) 
	- Small improvements
File with that name already exists.
Some poi categories matching to the query were found :
Local data to search POI is not present.
The poi data file \'%1$s\' is deprecated and can be deleted.
Local file to maintain poi changes not found and could not be created.
Changing poi inside application doesn\'t affect map files you downloaded but collects all changes in local file.
On server are map files incompatible with your current version of application. To download and use them, please upgrade the application to newer version.
Choose time interval to continue map following at the location
Download new, or move to backup or delete existing data. \nCurrent offline data on device (%1$s is available):

Recent changes for 0.6.7 : 
	- Offline data manager (download, delete, backup offline data directly in Osmand) 
	- Favorite points and groups (categorize, delete, manage favorites) 
	- GPX Explorer in application (see tracks, distance, average speed, elevation, etc.) 
	- GPX navigation (useful options, continue navigation after crash, supports roundabouts) 
	- Function to save route as GPX track to use it offline 
	- Improve GPX monitoring (filter some inaccurate location and save accuracy/elevation/speed) 
	- Upload GPX for OSM community (http://download.osmand.net/gpx/) 
	- Improve vector rendering 
	- Improvement of TTS engine (pronounce exact distance, enable miles) 
	- Bug fixing
File with same name already exists.
Upload GPX files to OSM community. They will be used to improve maps.
Show some vector map detail (roads etc.) at lower zooms already
You are going to delete %1$d favorite(s) and %2$d favorite group(s). Are you sure?
Base world map (covering whole world at small zooms) is missing. Please consider downloading World_basemap_x.obf for a complete environment.
On board (\'offline\') data is missing on SD card. Please consider to download it in order to use maps offline.

Select text size for names on the map
Show rendering performance data for debugging purposes

Recent changes for 0.6.6 : 
	- Text To Speech engine for voice navigation 
	- Make map renderer more detailed 
	- Basemap for whole world packaged with app 
	- Tweak offline routing (still experimental) 
	- GPX routing options 
	- UI update and large bug fixing
You are about to use an online routing service but there is no internet connection. You can try the (still experimental) OsmAnd offline routing service (select in \'Settings\' -> \'Navigation\'.

The selected language is not supported by the installed Android TTS (text-to-speech) engine. Do you want to go to the Market to look for another TTS engine? Otherwise the preset TTS language will be used.
No data for the selected language is installed. Do you want to go to the Market to install?

You can choose whether and how the map display is rotated in 'Settings' -> 'General Settings' -> 'Map rotation'. 
	The choices are: 
	'Don't rotate' - Map will not be rotated. North will be always up 
	'To direction of movement' - Map will continuously be aligned with your heading 
	'To compass' - Map will continuously be aligned with device compass reading 
	Hint: To quickly change between rotation by compass and the one you selected in settings, you can simply tap on the compass needle in map view.
Current position not covered in your offline vector maps, you can switch map source in menu \'Define view\' -> \'Map Source...\' or need to download additional vector map.
You can switch to offline vector maps using menu (Define view -> Map Source... -> Offline vector maps) to see the map.
Successful. You can switch to offline vector maps on menu Define view -> Map Source... -> Offline vector maps.
Choose channel to play voice guidance (system-dependent)
Application cannot download map layer %1$s, please try to reinstall it.
Map is already installed, settings will be updated
Select (tile) maps to install or update
Internet connection required for operation is not available

Having up-to-date map data is essential. OsmAnd provides a download manager which can check for available offline data updates. 
	To check for updates go to 'Main Menu' -> 'Settings' -> 'Offline data' -> 'Download offline data'. After region list is retrieved from the internet, you can select option 'Menu' -> 'Filter downloaded' to indicate updates only for data already on your device. 
	The availability of updates is depicted by the following colors: 
	'Green' - indicates data files identical on device and server 
	'Blue' - indicates available updates on server
Minimum zoom level to use vector rendering instead of map tiles

The map appearance can for some vector maps be changed between day (brighter) and night (darker). 
	Night colors are safer for night driving. 
	You can set a policy for day/night switching in 'Main Menu' -> 'Settings' -> 'Map appearance' ->'Day/night mode'. 
	Choices are: 
	'Sunrise/Sunset' - automatic mode, controlled by position of the sun (default) 
	'Day' - always use day mode 
	'Night' - always use night mode 
	'Light sensor' - map appearance is controlled by light sensor of your device (only if equipped)

You can share the location of interesting places on your trip with family or friends. 
	To share any location you want: 
	Use 'Map context menu' -> 'Share location' menu. 
	Then select a way to share your location. The choices are: E-Mail, SMS(text), or just copy location coordinates to clipboard.

Frequently used points can be saved as Favorites. 
	To save a point as Favorite go to the map context menu, select option 'Add to favorites' and then enter a name for it. After saving a Favorite, it is accessible via 'Main Menu' -> 'Favorites'. 
	Long pressing on a Favorite in the 'Favorites' menu provides options to Navigate to, Edit or Delete it. 
	To display all Favorite points directly on the map, enable layer 'Favorites' in 'Map context menu' ->'Define view'.

OsmAnd uses maps based on Openstreetmap.org (OSM) data and -besides map viewing and routing- can be used to improve OSM data quality. You can easily create and upload new POI or OSM bug reports with just a few clicks! 
	For this you need to first provide your OSM login information in 'Main Menu' -> 'Settings' -> 'OSM'. 
	To add a new POI use option 'Create POI' in the map context menu. Proceed with entering the information about the new POI in 'Create POI' dialog and finally commit it. 
	Errors in maps can immediately be reported via OSM bug, and OSM community can then faster fix this problem. 
	To add a OSM bug use option 'Open OSM bug' in the map context menu. Then enter the detailed description of the problem and finally post it using the 'Add' button. 
	Please note that Internet connectivity is needed for OSM POI and and OSM bug contributions.
Online OSM map classification with images

\tThe fastest way to change the map source and layers displayed is pressing \'Menu\' -> \'Define view\' in map view. \n\tUnder \'Map source...\' you can choose using the pre-loaded offline vector maps, predefined (online) tile sources, or maps manually created using e.g. OsmAndMapCreator on a PC. \n\tOsmAnd also supports custom sources.
\tOsmAnd supports different (customizable) application profiles for different use cases. \n\tYou can change profiles in \'Menu\' -> \'Settings\' -> \'Application mode\', or when creating a route.
\tBefore starting navigation (routing) you need to select a destination point first. After that press \'Menu\' -> \'Directions\' on map and select navigation type.

\tYou can select a destination point directly in the map (context menu, then \'Navigate to\'), or in all search activities. \n\tYou can also navigate to any favorite point via long pressing it in \'Favorites\'.

\tYou can search for places directly on the map, or by address, by location, as POI, or as predefined favorite. \n\tPressing \'Search\' in the main menu opens the search activities. For all hits a context menu offers 2 options: \'Navigate to\' or \'Show on map\'.

\tThe map context menu is available by long pressing on the map or by pressing the trackball button. \n\tThis produces a box with point coordinates. To open the map context menu dialog, tap on it. (Or long press on it to hide the box again.) \n\tThe map context menu contains all actions referring to a point (location).

\tA key element in OsmAnd is the destination point, marked as a red disk on the map. \n\tOsmAnd displays the distance to it and the direction to it (red arrow) on the map. \n\tTo mark any point as destination select \'Navigate to\'. This option is available on all search hits and in the map context menu (long press on any map item).
\tOsmAndAccess is a navigation application with many features. \n\tAs an basic introduction, some usage tips and tricks are linked on the main menu screen.
Change units of length and speed
To see location follow the web browser link %1$s or android intent link %2$s
Add waypoint to recorded GPX track

Use OsmAnd offline routing for long distances (experimental)
OsmAnd offline routing is an experimental feature and it doesn\'t work for distances of more than about 20 km.\n Routing service is automatically switched to online Cloudmade.
Changing the storage directory will not move or delete the data. This must be performed separately and outside OsmAnd. Continue anyway?
A previous OsmAnd version is installed. All offline data will be supported by new the new application. But Favorite points should be exported in the old application and later imported by the new one.

SD card is read-only.\nYou can only see the preloaded map and can\'t download from the Internet.

Thank you for choosing OsmAndAccess. \nTo use all features of the application you need some regional offline data, which you can download (Settings, Offline Data) or prepare yourself. Afterwards, you will be able to search by address, search for POIs, and search for public transport.
